quote: Sometimes even to live is an act of courage.
author: Seneca

quote: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
author: Seneca

quote: Religion is regarded by the common people as true, by the wise as false, and by rulers as useful.
author: Seneca

quote: We suffer more often in imagination than in reality
author: Seneca

quote: Begin at once to live, and count each separate day as a separate life.
author: Seneca

quote: If you have a garden and a library, you have everything you need.
author: Cicero

quote: It is easier to find men who will volunteer to die, than to find those who are willing to endure pain with patience.
author: Julius Caesar

quote: The universe is transformation: life is opinion.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Nothing happens to any man that he is not formed by nature to bear.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Nowhere can man find a quieter or more untroubled retreat than in his own soul.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: You have power over your mind-not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Success is walking from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Never give in except to convictions of honor and good sense.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Try not to become a man of success. Rather become a man of value.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: I find that the harder I work, the more luck I seem to have.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Success is not final; failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: The successful warrior is the average man, with laser-like focus.
author: Bruce Lee

quote: If you can dream it, you can do it.
author: Walt Disney

quote: We are all insects. Groping towards something terrible or divine.
author: Philip K. Dick, The Man in the High Castle

quote: Life has no meaning the moment you lose the illusion of being eternal.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: We do not know what we want and yet we are responsible for what we are - that is the fact.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: I took a test in Existentialism. I left all the answers blank and got 100.
author: Woody Allen

quote: All life is an experiment. The more experiments you make the better.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: There is something infantile in the presumption that somebody else has a responsibility to give your life meaning and point? The truly adult view, by contrast, is that our life is as meaningful, as full and as wonderful as we choose to make it.
author: Richard Dawkins

quote: For small creatures such as we the vastness is bearable only through love.
author: Carl Sagan

quote: Smooth and smiling faces everywhere, but ruin in their eyes.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: Society cares for the individual only so far as he is profitable.
author: Simone De Beauvoir

quote: When an individual is kept in a situation of inferiority, the fact is that he does become inferior.
author: Simone De Beauvoir

quote: I opened myself to the gentle indifference of the world.
author: Albert Camus

quote: The world is, of course, nothing but our conception of it.
author: Anton Chekhov

quote: Convictions are more dangerous foes of truth than lies.
author: Nietzsche

quote: Youth ends when egotism does; maturity begins when one lives for others.
author: Hermann Hesse, Gertrude.

quote: There is no reality except in action.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: We love the things we love for what they are.
author: Robert Frost

quote: At the touch of a lover, everyone becomes a poet.
author: Plato

quote: I have loved the stars too fondly to be fearful of the night.
author: Sarah Williams

quote:
This is the way the world ends
Not with a bang but a whimper.
author: T.S. Eliot

quote:
Because I could not stop for Death
He kindly stopped for me
The Carriage held but just Ourselves
And Immortality.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: April is the cruellest month
author: T.S. Eliot

quote: I will show you fear in a handful of dust
author: T.S. Eliot

quote: I have measured out my life with coffee spoons
author: T.S. Eliot

quote: Humankind cannot bear very much reality
author: T.S. Eliot

quote: We could all have been killed-or worse, expelled
author: Hermione Granger

quote: One can never have enough socks
author: Albus Dumbledore

quote: Alas! Ear wax!
author: Albus Dumbledore

quote: Yer a wizard Harry.
author: Hagrid

quote: It does not do well to dwell on dreams and forget to live
author: Albus Dumbledore

quote: It takes a great deal of bravery to stand up to our enemies, but just as much to stand up to our friends
author: Albus Dumbledore

quote: Fear of a name only increases fear of the thing itself
author: Hermione Granger

quote: It is our choices, Harry, that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities
author: Albus Dumbledore

quote: Fame's a fickle friend, Harry.
author: Gilderoy Lockhart

quote: I solemnly swear I am up to no good.
author: Harry Potter

quote: We are only as strong as we are united, as weak as we are divided.
author: Albus Dumbledore

quote: Just because it's taken you three years to notice, Ron, doesn't mean no one else has spotted I'm a girl!
author: Hermione Granger

quote: It is the unknown we fear when we look upon death and darkness, nothing more.
author: Albus Dumbledore

quote: Just because you have the emotional range of a teaspoon doesn't mean we all have.
author: Hermione Granger

quote: I will build a great, great wall on our southern border, and I will have Mexico pay for that wall. Mark my words.
author: Donald Trump

quote: I will be phenomenal to the women. I mean, I want to help women.
author: Donald Trump

quote: It's really cold outside, they are calling it a major freeze, weeks ahead of normal. Man, we could use a big fat dose of global warming!
author: Donald Trump

quote: No matter what you do - guns, no guns - it doesn't matter. You have people that are mentally ill. And they're gonna come through the cracks. And they're going to do things that people will not even believe are possible.
author: Donald Trump

quote: When you see the other side chopping off heads, waterboarding doesn't sound very severe.
author: Donald Trump

quote: To be blunt, people would vote for me. They just would. Why? Maybe because I'm so good looking.
author: Donald Trump

quote: I never attacked him on his looks, and believe me, there's plenty of subject matter right there.
author: Trump on Rand Paul

quote: I look very much forward to showing my financials, because they are huge.
author: Donald Trump

quote: All of the women on The Apprentice flirted with me - consciously or unconsciously. That's to be expected.
author: Donald Trump

quote: Certain guys tell me they want women of substance, not beautiful models. It just means they can't get beautiful models.
author: Donald Trump

quote: I could stand in the middle of 5th Avenue and shoot somebody and I wouldn't lose voters.
author: Donald Trump

quote: You could see there was bloody coming out of her eyes. Blood coming out of her wherever.
author: Donald Trump

quote: Despite the constant negative press covfefe
author: Donald Trump

quote: What you're seeing and what you're reading is not what's happening
author: Donald Trump

quote: Show me someone without an ego, and I'll show you a loser.
author: Donald Trump

quote: Do or do not. There is no try.
author: Yoda

quote: Fear leads to anger, anger leads to hate, hate leads to suffering.
author: Yoda

quote: Why, you stuck-up half-witted scruffy-looking nerf herder.
author: Princess Leia

quote: Laugh it up, fuzzball!
author: Han Solo

quote: Would somebody get this big walking carpet out of my way?
author: Princess Leia

quote: There's always a bigger fish.
author: Qui-Gon Jinn

quote: These aren't the droids you're looking for.
author: Obi-Wan Kenobi

quote: Women always figure out the truth. Always.

quote: I find your lack of faith disturbing.
author: Darth Vader

quote: Never tell me the odds.
author: Han Solo

quote: Let the past die. Kill it if you have to.

quote: Who's the more foolish? The fool or the fool who follows him?
author: Obi-Wan Kenobi

quote: Be careful not to choke on your aspirations.
author: Darth Vader

quote: Stay on target.
author: Gold Five

quote: The leading cause of death among fashion models is falling through street grates.
author: Dave Barry

quote: People who want to share their religious views with you almost never want you to share yours with them.
author: Dave Barry

quote: Have you noticed that whatever sport you're trying to learn, some earnest person is always telling you to keep your knees bent?
author: Dave Barry

quote: Camping is nature's way of promoting the motel business.
author: Dave Barry

quote: Although golf was originally restricted to wealthy, overweight Protestants, today it's open to anybody who owns hideous clothing.
author: Dave Barry

quote: If you had to identify, in one word, the reason why the human race has not achieved, and never will achieve, its full potential, that word would be 'meetings'.
author: Dave Barry

quote: It is inhumane, in my opinion, to force people who have a genuine medical need for coffee to wait in line behind people who apparently view it as some kind of recreational activity.
author: Dave Barry

quote: Hobbies of any kind are boring except to people who have the same hobby. This is also true of religion, although you will not find me saying so in print.
author: Dave Barry

quote: The metric system did not really catch on in the States, unless you count the increasing popularity of the nine-millimeter bullet.
author: Dave Barry

quote: What I look forward to is continued immaturity followed by death.
author: Dave Barry

quote: Meetings are an addictive, highly self-indulgent activity that corporations and other large organizations habitually engage in only because they cannot actually masturbate.
author: Dave Barry

quote: Scientists now believe that the primary biological function of breasts is to make males stupid.
author: Dave Barry

quote: Fishing is boring, unless you catch an actual fish, and then it is disgusting.
author: Dave Barry

quote: You can only be young once. But you can always be immature.
author: Dave Barry

quote: Bill Gates is a very rich man today... and do you want to know why? The answer is one word: versions.
author: Dave Barry

quote: Life is anything that dies when you stomp on it.
author: Dave Barry

quote: The word user is the word used by the computer professional when they mean idiot.
author: Dave Barry

quote: Be good and you will be lonesome.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Keep away from people who try to belittle your ambitions. Small people always do that, but the really great make you feel that you, too, can become great.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Classic'-a book which people praise and don't read.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Never argue with stupid people, they will drag you down to their level and then beat you with experience.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life.
author: Mark Twain

quote: The secret of success is making your vocation your vacation.
author: Mark Twain

quote: If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything.
author: Mark Twain

quote: I have never let my schooling interfere with my education.
author: Mark Twain

quote: A clear conscience is the sure sign of a bad memory.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Wrinkles should merely indicate where the smiles have been.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Man is the only animal that blushes. Or needs to.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Honor is a harder master than law.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Character is the architect of achievements.
author: Mark Twain

quote: The lack of money is the root of all evil.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Travel is fatal to prejudice.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Age is an issue of mind over matter. If you don't mind, it doesn't matter.
author: Mark Twain

quote: I can live for two months on a good compliment.
author: Mark Twain

quote: We have the best government that money can buy.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Beware; for I am fearless, and therefore powerful.
author: Monster

quote: Life, although it may only be an accumulation of anguish, is dear to me, and I will defend it.
author: Monster

quote: If I cannot inspire love, I will cause fear!
author: Monster

quote: I ought to be thy Adam, but I am rather the fallen angel...
author: Monster

quote: I was benevolent and good; misery made me a fiend. Make me happy, and I shall again be virtuous.
author: Monster

quote: The fallen angel becomes a malignant devil. Yet even that enemy of God and man had friends and associates in his desolation; I am alone.
author: Monster

quote: The companions of our childhood always possess a certain power over our minds which hardly any later friend can obtain.
author: Frankenstein

quote: But it was all a dream; no Eve soothed my sorrows nor shared my thoughts; I was alone. I remembered Adam's supplication to his Creator. But where was mine? He had abandoned me, and in the bitterness of my heart I cursed him.
author: Monster

quote: Nothing is so painful to the human mind as a great and sudden change.
author: Frankenstein

quote: Sir Isaac Newton is said to have avowed that he felt like a child picking up shells beside the great and unexplored ocean of truth.
author: Frankenstein

quote: Something is rotten in the state of Denmark.
author: Marcellus

quote: There is nothing either good or bad, but thinking makes it so.
author: Hamlet

quote: There are more things in Heaven and Earth, Horatio, than are dreamt of in your philosophy.
author: Hamlet

quote: Brevity is the soul of wit.
author: Polonius

quote: One may smile, and smile, and be a villain.
author: Hamlet

quote: God hath given you one face, and you make yourself another.
author: Hamlet

quote: To be or not to be that is the question.
author: Hamlet

quote: A little more than kin, a little less than kind.
author: Hamlet

quote: Alas, poor Yorick! I knew him, Horatio.
author: Hamlet

quote: You can always count on Americans to do the right thing - after they've tried everything else.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Envy is the central fact of American life.
author: Gore Vidal

quote: Most of American life consists of driving somewhere and then returning home, wondering why the hell you went.
author: John Updike

quote: The surface of American life looks smooth, prosperous, peaceful. But underneath, fault-line shifts in family and work life have led us into what some have called 'advanced insecurity.'
author: Arlie Russell Hochschild

quote: Gender is probably the most restricting force in American life.
author: Gloria Stein

quote: Vietnam was the defining event for my generation. It spilled over into all facets of American life - into music, into the pulpits, in churches of our country. It spilled over into the city streets, police forces. And even if you were born late in the generation, Vietnam was still part of your childhood.
author: Tim O'Brien

quote: There is a paranoid streak in American life. Radio talk show hosts tend to foment that paranoid streak in American life.
author: Alan Dershowitz

quote: America is the only country that went from barbarism to decadence without civilization in between.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Every other nation has folk traditions of men who were poor but extremely wise and virtuous, and therefore more estimable than anyone with power and gold. No such tales are told by the American poor.
author: Kurt Vonnegut, Slaughterhouse-Five

quote: Remember, remember always, that all of us, and you and I especially, are descended from immigrants and revolutionists.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: In America, anyone can become president. That's the problem.
author: George Carlin

quote: America was not built on fear. America was built on courage, on imagination and an unbeatable determination to do the job at hand.
author: Harry S Truman

quote: Europe was created by history. America was created by philosophy.
author: Margaret Thatcher

quote: It's safe to assume that by 2085 guns will be sold in vending machines but you won't be able to smoke anywhere in America.
author: David Sedaris, When You Are Engulfed in Flames

quote: Those who do not complain are never pitied.
author: Mrs. Bennet

quote: Think only of the past as its remembrance gives you pleasure.
author: Elizabeth Bennet

quote: It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife.
author: Jane Austen

quote: Happiness in marriage is entirely a matter of chance.
author: Charlotte Lucas

quote: There is, I believe, in every disposition a tendency to some particular evil-a natural defect, which not even the best education can overcome.
author: Darcy

quote: My courage always rises at every attempt to intimidate me.
author: Elizabeth Bennet

quote: It is particularly incumbent on those who never change their opinion, to be secure of judging properly at first.
author: Elizabeth Bennet

quote: For what do we live, but to make sport for our neighbors, and laugh at them in our turn?
author: Mr. Bennet

quote: A lady's imagination is very rapid; it jumps from admiration to love, from love to matrimony in a moment.
author: Darcy

quote: Do anything rather than marry without affection.
author: Jane Bennet

quote: My good opinion once lost, is lost forever.
author: Darcy

quote: There is nothing more deceptive than an obvious fact.
author: Arthur Conan Doyle, The Boscombe Valley Mystery

quote: Mediocrity knows nothing higher than itself; but talent instantly recognizes genius.
author: Arthur Conan Doyle, The Valley of Fear

quote: You have a grand gift for silence, Watson. It makes you quite invaluable as a companion.
author: Arthur Conan Doyle, The Complete Sherlock Holmes

quote: What you do in this world is a matter of no consequence. The question is what can you make people believe you have done.
author: Arthur Conan Doyle, A Study in Scarlet

quote: The game is afoot.
author: Arthur Conan Doyle, Adventure of the Abbey Grange

quote: To a great mind, nothing is little.
author: Arthur Conan Doyle, A Study in Scarlet

quote: Education never ends, Watson. It is a series of lessons, with the greatest for the last.
author: Arthur Conan Doyle, His Last Bow

quote: Excellent!" I cried. "Elementary," said he.
author: Arthur Conan Doyle, The Memoirs of Sherlock Holmes

quote: If more of us valued food and cheer and song above hoarded gold, it would be a merrier world.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

quote: A balanced diet is a cookie in each hand.
author: Barbara Johnson

quote: People who love to eat are always the best people.
author: Julia Child

quote: If you really want to make a friend, go to someone's house and eat with him...the people who give you their food give you their heart.
author: Cesar Chavez

quote: Ice cream is exquisite. What a pity it isn't illegal.
author: Voltaire

quote: It's okay to eat fish because they don't have any feelings.
author: Kurt Cobain

quote: So long as you have food in your mouth, you have solved all questions for the time being.
author: Franz Kafka

quote: A crust eaten in peace is better than a banquet partaken in anxiety.
author: Aesop

quote: A waffle is like a pancake with a syrup trap.
author: Mitch Hedberg

quote: He was a bold man that first ate an oyster.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: After a good dinner one can forgive anybody, even one's own relatives.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: My fake plants died because I did not pretend to water them.
author: Mitch Hedberg

quote: A severed foot is the perfect stocking stuffer.
author: Mitch Hedberg

quote: Every book is a children's book if the kid can read!
author: Mitch Hedberg

quote: I used to do drugs. I still do, but I used to, too.
author: Mitch Hedberg

quote: Dogs are forever in the push-up position.
author: Mitch Hedberg

quote: Fettucini alfredo is macaroni and cheese for adults.
author: Mitch Hedberg

quote: Why are there no during pictures.
author: Mitch Hedberg

quote: I would imagine that if you could understand Morse code, a tap dancer would drive you crazy.
author: Mitch Hedberg

quote: I'm against picketing, but I don't know how to show it.
author: Mitch Hedberg

quote: I think animal crackers make people think that all animals taste the same.
author: Mitch Hedberg

quote: I do not fear computers. I fear lack of them.
author: Isaac Asimov

quote: A computer once beat me at chess, but it was no match for me at kick boxing.
author: Emo Philips

quote: Computer Science is no more about computers than astronomy is about telescopes.
author: Edsger W. Dijkstra

quote: Computers are like Old Testament gods; lots of rules and no mercy.
author: Joseph Campbell

quote: Man is still the most extraordinary computer of all.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Computers are useless. They can only give you answers.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: Treat your password like your toothbrush. Don't let anybody else use it, and get a new one every six months.
author: Clifford Stoll

quote: In short, software is eating the world.
author: Marc Andreessen

quote: Right now, computers, which are supposed to be our servant, are oppressing us.
author: Jef Raskin

quote: Everybody should learn to program a computer, because it teaches you how to think.
author: Steve Jobs

quote: Computers are good at following instructions, but not at reading your mind.
author: Donald Knuth
